var i:Integer; const a=' bottles of beer';b=' on the wall! ';c=' Take one down, pass it around, '; begin for i:= 99 downto 1 do WriteLn(IntToStr(i)+a+b+IntToStr(i)+a+#33+c+IntToStr(i-1)+a+b); end.

I completely forgot about downto, I remember once that if you did something like 99 to 1, it would go down, but when I tried that it didn’t work, cheers!

[quote author=Ron link=topic=193636.msg1743645#msg1743645 date=1189371323]

To find the smallest possible 99 Bottles of beer? Cruel’s found the most efficient(and smallest) so far.

I’ve got an idea, scripting competition, whoever can make the most efficient version of a main, sloppy script wins, how about it?[/quote]

item.title: Smallest 99 bottles of beer possible?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“script_owned4, post:11, topic:141399”][code]var x,y:integer;

begin
x:=0;
y:=99;
repeat Writeln(IntToStr(y) + ’ Bottles of Beer On the Wall’);
x:= x + 1;
until(x=99);
end.[/code]

I know this script doesen’t say 1-99 but it says 99 bottles 99 times Also I know this isn’t shorter just felt like doing this, and what about what Ron said…What is this script about lol![/quote]
Just a few tips.
You don’t have to put

x:= 0;

The integer, if never used before, starts at 0.

And also, you could use the x integer in a for loop.

for x:= 99 downto 0 do Writeln(inttostr(x));

Counts from 99 down to 0 and Writes it or…

for x:= 0 to 99 do Writeln(inttostr(x));

Count from 0 to 99 and Writes it.

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest 99 bottles of beer possible?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I don’t get it. What’s the point of this? lol

Here’s a little complicated one as well. A little easier to read though. 

program HundredBottlesOfBeerByRon;

const
  HowManyBottles = 100; // Num of bottles to go through.
  WaitTime = 8000;      // The WaitTime in between each bottle in milliseconds.

var
  arrBottle, arrDrink, arrPlace : array of string;
  WhichBottle, WhichDrink, WhichPlace,
  NumOfBottles, WaitT, i : integer;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  arrBottle := ['bottle', 'cup', 'glass', 'mug', 'jug'];
  arrDrink := ['beer', 'soda', 'water', 'lemonade', 'ice tea'];
  arrPlace := ['wall', 'ground', 'ceiling', 'house', 'table'];
  WhichBottle := Random(GetArrayLength(arrBottle));
  WhichDrink := Random(GetArrayLength(arrDrink));
  WhichPlace := Random(GetArrayLength(arrPlace));
  NumOfBottles := HowManyBottles;
  if (NumOfBottles < 10) then
    NumOfBottles := 10;
  WaitT := WaitTime;
  if (WaitT < 10) then
    WaitT := 10;
  for i := NumOfBottles downto 1 do
  begin
    WriteLn(IntToStr(i) + ' ' + arrBottle[WhichBottle] + '(s) of ' + arrDrink[WhichDrink] + ' on the ' + arrPlace[WhichPlace] + '. ' + IntToStr(i) + ' ' + arrBottle[WhichBottle] + '(s) of ' + arrDrink[WhichDrink] + '.');
    WriteLn('  Take one down, pass it around.');
    if (i > 1) then
      WriteLn('  ' + IntToStr(i - 1) + ' ' + arrBottle[WhichBottle] + '(s) of ' + arrDrink[WhichDrink] + ' on the ' + arrPlace[WhichPlace] + '.');
    Wait(WaitT);
  end;
  WriteLn('');
  WriteLn('~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~');
  WriteLn(' No more ' + arrBottle[WhichBottle] + '(s) of ' + arrDrink[WhichDrink] + ' on the ' + arrPlace[WhichPlace] + '!');
  WriteLn('~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~');
end.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest 99 bottles of beer possible?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Now the most complex. 

type Beverages = record
  c: Integer;
  n, p, a: String;
end;


type Count = record
  b: array [1..5] of Beverages;
  t: Integer;
end;

var x: Count;
var i, e, t: Integer;
var s, tt: String;
begin
  x.b[1].n:= 'Lemonade'; x.b[1].p:= 'Fence'; x.b[1].a:= 'Shoot';
  x.b[2].n:= 'Coke'; x.b[2].p:= 'Window Sill'; x.b[2].a:= 'Push';
  x.b[3].n:= 'Pepsi'; x.b[3].p:= 'Ground'; x.b[3].a:= 'Squash';
  x.b[4].n:= 'Beer'; x.b[4].p:= 'Tree'; x.b[4].a:= 'Tackle';
  x.b[5].n:= 'Shit'; x.b[5].p:= 'Guitar'; x.b[5].a:= 'Strum';
  for e:= 1 to 5 do
  begin
    x.b[e].c:= 40 + Random(60);
    x.t:= x.t + x.b[e].c;
  end;
  repeat
    repeat
      e:= Random(5) + 1;
      i:= Random(5);
    until(x.b[e].c >= 0) and (x.b[e].c-i >= 0);
    x.t:= x.t-i;
    s:= '';
    for t:= 1 to 2 do
    begin
      s:= s + inttostr(x.b[e].c) + ' Bottles of ' + x.b[e].n;
      if (t = 1) then s:= s + ' on the ' + x.b[e].p + ', ';
    end;
    Writeln(s);
    if (i > 1) then tt:= 'them' else tt:= 'it';
    Writeln('You ' + x.b[e].a + ' ' + inttostr(i) + ' Down, Pass ' + tt + ' around:');
    x.b[e].c:= x.b[e].c-i;
    Writeln(inttostr(x.b[e].c) + ' Bottles of ' + x.b[e].n + ' on the ' + x.b[e].p);
    Writeln(inttostr(x.t) + ' Total Beverages in the yard..');
    Writeln(' ');
  until(x.t <= 0);
  Writeln('That'#39's all the Beverages we have time for..');
end.

sigh Good times with random scripts…

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest 99 bottles of beer possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:4, topic:141399”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=193636.msg1740889#msg1740889 date=1189287909]
3 Problems with that :
1 : n isn’t a string, can’t apply a string to an integer.
2 : you need begin + end for more than 1 line
3 : it’s 11 lines fixed.
[/quote]

Amusing. Well that just showed how inept I was at scripting. But anyway, the “0 - Bottles” thing could be changed from “Bottles - Bottles - Bottles.”[/quote]

Yeah, I realized when I fixed your script up, I didn’t think of 0 - Bottles when I did it.

item.title: Smallest 99 bottles of beer possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:141399”][code]
var
Bottles, n : Integer;

begin
for Bottles := -99 to -1 do
n = IntToStr(0 - Bottles);
Writeln(n + ’ bottles of beer on the wall, ’ + n + ’ bottles of beer! Take one down, pass it around, ’ + n + ’ bottles of beer on the wall!’);
end.
[/code][/quote]

3 Problems with that :
1 : n isn’t a string, can’t apply a string to an integer.
2 : you need begin + end for more than 1 line
3 : it’s 11 lines fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest 99 bottles of beer possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[code]var
Bottles : Integer;

begin
for Bottles := -99 to -1 do
Writeln(IntToStr(Bottles - Bottles - Bottles) + ’ Bottles of beer on the wall, ’ + IntToStr(Bottles - Bottles - Bottles) + ’ bottles of beer! Take one down, pass it around, ’ + IntToStr(Bottles - Bottles - Bottles) + ’ bottles of beer on the wall!’);
end.[/code]

Obviously it can be smaller, but for the sake of readable code, is this the smallest possible 99 bottles of beer on the wall in SCAR?

Read full topic
